summary: The Higgs boson is a tiny particle that helps explain why other particles have mass. It's like a missing piece in a puzzle called the Standard Model, which describes how the universe works at a tiny scale. Scientists predicted its existence, and in 2012, they found it at the Large Hadron Collider in Switzerland. This discovery was a big deal, earning a Nobel Prize! It's named after Peter Higgs, who was one of the scientists who came up with the idea. Some people call it the "God particle," but scientists don't like this name.
title: Higgs boson
